intro: Ludwigia speciosa, commonly known as the pretty Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of streams, where it thrives in moist to aquatic conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and can be submerged or floating, depending on the water level. Ludwigia speciosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and ponds due to its aesthetic appeal.
